DataElement.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Revised 11 Past Week How Often Slept Much More than Usual Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of how often in the past week they slept much more than usual, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Revised Past Week How Often Slept Much More than Usual Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-report screening test for depression and depressive disorder measuring symptoms defined by the American Psychiatric Association Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM-V) for a major depressive episode._The most recent week, including today._A question about the frequency of an event or behavior._A question about whether an individual sleeps or slept much more than usual._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Revised
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-report screening test for depression and depressive disorder measuring symptoms defined by the American Psychiatric Association Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM-V) for a major depressive episode.

Concepts.longName: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Revised
Concepts.definition: A self-report screening test for depression and depressive disorder measuring symptoms defined by the American Psychiatric Association Diagnostic and Statistical Manual (DSM-V) for a major depressive episode.

Property.preferredName: Past Week How Often Slept Much More than Usual Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week, including today.:A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.:A question about whether an individual sleeps or slept much more than usual.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about the frequency of an event or behavior.
A question about whether an individual sleeps or slept much more than usual.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: CESD-R:The Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale Revised. Eaton WW, et.al., 2004
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance A011502 study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 4/12/2016

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened nearly every day for two weeks.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened nearly every day for two weeks.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened between five and seven days.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened between five and seven days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened on three or four days.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened on three or four days.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something happens or happened on one or two days.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something happens or happened on one or two days.
A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
